subtitle: In a bold and innovative move to reverse the fate of Wild Dogs in southern Africa, the first pack was reintroduced into Gorongosa National Park on April 16, 2018.
title: Wild Dogs Return to Gorongosa

subtitle: Meet the top 10 news species of 2018, selected by our Global Biodiversity Census partners at SUNY College of Environmental Science and Forestry.
title: 2018 Top 10 New Species

subtitle: In this March 4, 2018 New York Times Sunday Review opinion piece, E.O. Wilson explains why species are the fundamental level of study that must be used to identify conservation priorities, and how the Half-Earth Project map is leading the way.
title: The 8 Million Species We Don’t Know

subtitle: Our Half-Earth Project partner Tompkins Conservation completed the last of their historic 10 million acre national park expansion in Chile. Conservation areas derive their true greatness from the species that call these places home.
title: Species at the Core

subtitle: Species are being “swept away in an ecological catastrophe that has come to be known as the sixth extinction.” It is invertebrates in general and insects in particular that are facing the worst of this crisis.
title: The Little Things That Run The World
